title: Windows 11â€™s new built-in video editing app is an expensive subscription service; iMovie still free
content:
When Microsoft released Windows 11 Insider Preview build 22572 yesterday, it added a couple of new inbox apps to the OS. One of them is called Clipchamp, a service that Microsoft acquired back in September. It’s a cloud-based video editing service, and it’s the first real push at a video editor that Microsoft has made

The post Windows 11’s new built-in video editing app is an expensive subscription service; iMovie still free appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Microsoft is going to start pre-installing a new video editing app on Windows 11 called Clipchamp but you'll have to pay for it to be useful.
